channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Two Big Insurers Still Betting on Fossil Fuels
item.description: Most companies have cut back on oil, gas and coal investments after big climate-related losses. But State Farm and Berkshire Hathaway’s insurance comp...

item.title: ‘She’s the queen of CDs’: My mother-in-law, 83, opened 12 CDs at different financial institutions. Should I intervene?
item.description: “Given her advanced age and risk aversion, I question whether pursuing these interest rates and promotional offers is truly worthwhile.”

item.title: The High-Stakes Spat Over How Much Oil the World Really Needs
item.description: OPEC is sticking with its estimate that the world will need an extra two million barrels a day this year, despite signs this is unrealistic.

item.title: ECB will cut rates more quickly than previously expected, HSBC says
item.description: The European Central Bank will likely make a series of consecutive 25 basis point cuts at each of its upcoming meetings between now and April 2025, HS...

item.title: How to Invest in Bonds in a World of Falling Rates
item.description: Buying bonds can confront investors with a bewildering array of options, including Treasurys, company bonds and municipal debt.

item.title: ‘I’m overwhelmed’: I inherited $185,000. With the Fed lowering rates, should I park it in 5% CDs or high-yield savings accounts?
item.description: “My brother got a better interest rate because he acted fast, and here I am twiddling my thumbs, overwhelmed with banks.”

item.title: Star FTX Witness Caroline Ellison Sentenced to Two Years in Prison
item.description: Former crypto executive contributed to a multibillion-dollar fraud.

item.title: Companies with high labor costs should benefit as job market slows. Some names are surprising.
item.description: The flip side of a labor market deteriorating is that wage pressure on profit margins ease. Here are companies that benefit.

item.title: Justice Department Sues Visa, Alleges Illegal Monopoly in Debit-Card Payments
item.description: The largest card network in the U.S. blocked rivals through payments and higher fees levied on merchants, the government said.

item.title: Benchmark Treasury yields hit three-week highs as traders eye PCE inflation data
item.description: Bond yields rose amid hopes the U.S. economy is enjoying a soft economic landing despite the Fed completing a monetary policy tightening cycle.
